attributes.action: Stop Taking PIP Off Unemployed Disabled People
attributes.additional_details: The retraction of PIP (over £1 million of which), is unjustifiable. There are many, many other ways to generate £1 million, that don't involve practically discriminating against disabled people, more than they already are.
attributes.background: The Labour govt need to stop taking benefits off some of the country's poorest, most disadvantaged people. Those who cannot work, those who cannot live alone, those who cannot live without their benefits. The govt need to stop taking money off them, and find other ways to get £1 million.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Protect Disabled people who cannot work from planned cuts to benefits
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/721547
